Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the significance of the accidental airing of a rehearsal clip, suggesting it is evidence of election fraud.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the accidental airing of the rehearsal clip was intentional and part of a pre-rigged election.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence to support the assertion of election fraud.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the rehearsal clip was an error and did not reflect the actual election results.
Understate: There is no evidence of any bias of understating in the provided claim.
Falters at times: There is no evidence of any bias of faltering at times in the provided claim.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider the alternative explanation that the accidental airing was simply a technical mistake during a rehearsal.
